root: ^Behold! A vision of a true bride!
^the mother exclaimed, her voice carrying a hint of sorrow.
^It grieves you more than it gladdens, does it not?

c-0: ^I guess it's because I realize how much my son never got to do in this life,
^she said in a melancholic tone, as if lost in thought.
^I have some doubts about the actions of the church

Doubts: ^Doubts, my child? What do you mean?
^Well, it seems to me that the church is more concerned with preserving its own power and authority than with truly helping the people

c-0: ^The matter is insignificant, pay it no mind
^I have witnessed firsthand the agony that the artist endures in the creation of the painting

c-1: ^I understand your compassion, my dear, but the church has its own way of doing things

Ending: ^she said, sounding like she was coming out of a daze,
^I reckon it's about time you got the church ready for the Black Wedding.
